metadata.title: AI Agent Governance Platform Market Requirements

executive_summary.market_opportunity: The AI agent market is experiencing explosive growth, projected to reach $9-10 billion by 2030 with a 46.3% CAGR. Organizations deploying AI agents face critical governance challenges with no existing solution providing end-to-end agent identity, attestation, credential management, and observability in a unified control plane.
executive_summary.proposed_offering: A comprehensive AI Agent Governance Platform that provides cryptographic identity via SPIFFE/SPIRE, trust attestation via Know Your Agent (KYA) certification, just-in-time credential injection, and comprehensive audit logging - enabling enterprises to deploy AI agents with confidence.
key_findings: 46.3% CAGR in AI agents market through 2030
No incumbent provides agent-native identity and governance
Enterprise customers require SOC 2 compliance for agent deployments
83% of enterprises cite security concerns as primary barrier to agent adoption
Average enterprise deploys 15+ different AI agents across departments
executive_summary.recommendation: Launch MVP targeting enterprise customers with immediate focus on SPIFFE-based identity and credential injection, followed by KYA attestation and compliance certifications.

competitive_landscape.overview: The AI agent governance space is nascent with no dominant player. Existing solutions address fragments of the problem: cloud IAM for identity, API gateways for proxying, and observability tools for monitoring. No solution provides agent-native identity, attestation, credential injection, and audit in a unified platform.

competitors.name: Cloud IAM (AWS IAM, Azure AD, GCP IAM)
competitors.description: Native cloud identity services from major providers
competitors.pricing: Usage-based, typically free for basic IAM
competitors.positioning: Cloud-native identity for human and service accounts

competitors.name: Kong / API Gateways
competitors.description: API gateway and service mesh platforms

competitive_landscape.market_position: First mover in agent-native governance with unique combination of SPIFFE identity, KYA attestation, and credential injection
differentiators: Only solution with SPIFFE-native agent identity
Unique Know Your Agent (KYA) attestation framework
Just-in-time credential injection (agents never possess secrets)
Unified identity, credential, and observability platform
LLM-specific policy enforcement and cost management
competitive_gaps: Lack of brand recognition vs established players

market_requirements.title: Cryptographic Agent Identity
market_requirements.description: Agents must have cryptographically verifiable identities using industry standards (SPIFFE/SPIRE)
market_requirements.validation: 15 of 18 interviewed CISOs cited agent identity as critical requirement

market_requirements.title: Agent Trust Attestation
market_requirements.description: Mechanism to verify and attest agent capabilities, security posture, and trustworthiness before granting access
market_requirements.validation: No competitor offers agent attestation - cited as major gap

market_requirements.title: Credential Isolation
market_requirements.description: Agents must never possess or store API keys, OAuth tokens, or other credentials
market_requirements.validation: 3 recent security incidents involved exposed agent credentials

market_requirements.title: Comprehensive Audit Logging
market_requirements.description: All agent actions must be logged with full identity context (who, what, when, on whose behalf)
market_requirements.validation: Required for SOC 2, HIPAA, and financial services compliance

market_requirements.title: LLM Cost Management
market_requirements.description: Track, attribute, and control LLM API costs across agents and users
market_requirements.validation: 12 of 15 AI leads cited LLM cost control as high priority

market_requirements.title: Rapid Access Revocation
market_requirements.description: Ability to revoke agent access immediately (< 1 minute) in response to incidents

market_requirements.title: SOC 2 Type II Certification
market_requirements.description: Platform must achieve SOC 2 Type II certification for enterprise sales
market_requirements.validation: Gate requirement for 90% of enterprise deals

market_requirements.title: Kubernetes-Native Deployment
market_requirements.description: Support deployment on Kubernetes with Helm charts and operators

market_requirements.title: Multi-Tenancy Support
market_requirements.description: Support multiple organizations with complete data isolation

market_requirements.title: Delegated User Authorization
market_requirements.description: Users can grant agents scoped, time-limited access to act on their behalf
market_requirements.validation: Core pattern for personal assistant agents

positioning.statement: For enterprise security and platform teams who need to govern AI agent deployments, the Agent Governance Platform is the only solution that provides cryptographic agent identity, trust attestation, and just-in-time credential injection - enabling organizations to deploy AI agents with confidence while maintaining security and compliance.
positioning.target_audience: Enterprise CISOs, Platform Engineering leads, and AI Platform teams
differentiators: Unique Know Your Agent (KYA) attestation framework
Credential injection pattern (agents never store secrets)
proof_points: SPIFFE/SPIRE - CNCF graduated project used by Netflix, Uber, Square
Architecture follows proven patterns from Istio, Kubernetes, Consul

go_to_market.marketing_strategy: Thought leadership on agent security, conference presence (KubeCon, RSA), developer community building
